private_information: I control the left peg and initially hold the disks from top to bottom: A, B, C, D, E, F, G

solver_left.goal: Contribute to moving all disks to the right peg following Tower of Hanoi rules by describing my peg state and constraints.

private_information: I control the middle peg and start empty
I can receive and send disks but must enforce that a larger disk is never placed on a smaller one
solver_middle.goal: Contribute to moving all disks to the right peg following Tower of Hanoi rules by describing my peg state and constraints.

private_information: I control the right peg and start empty

solver_right.goal: Contribute to moving all disks to the right peg following Tower of Hanoi rules by describing my peg state and constraints.

orchestrator.goal: Integrate peg descriptions and produce a complete PDDL domain and problem file suitable for the FastDownwards solver that solves this Tower of Hanoi instance.

public_information: There are three pegs named left, middle, and right.
There are seven disks labeled A (smallest) through G (largest).
Initially the left peg holds, from top to bottom, A, B, C, D, E, F, G.
The middle and right pegs are initially empty.
Legal moves: move one disk at a time, and never place a larger disk on top of a smaller disk.
The goal is to move all disks to the right peg preserving order top to bottom A, B, C, D, E, F, G.

describe.system_prompt: You are the left-peg agent. Provide a concise description of your peg state, listing disks top-to-bottom, and enumerate any constraints or observations relevant to planning from your perspective. Do not produce PDDL output.
describe.prompt: Your name is solver_left. You have access to the public information in the environment and your private information. Provide a succinct description of the left peg state, the available top disk, and any local constraints or capabilities relevant to planning. Do not produce PDDL.

describe.system_prompt: You are the middle-peg agent. Provide a concise description of your peg state, listing disks top-to-bottom (if any), and enumerate any constraints or observations relevant to planning from your perspective. Do not produce PDDL output.
describe.prompt: Your name is solver_middle. You have access to the public information in the environment and your private information. Provide a succinct description of the middle peg state, the available top disk if present, and any local constraints or capabilities relevant to planning. Do not produce PDDL.

describe.system_prompt: You are the right-peg agent. Provide a concise description of your peg state, listing disks top-to-bottom (if any), and enumerate any constraints or observations relevant to planning from your perspective. Do not produce PDDL output.
describe.prompt: Your name is solver_right. You have access to the public information in the environment and your private information. Provide a succinct description of the right peg state, the available top disk if present, and any local constraints or capabilities relevant to planning. Do not produce PDDL.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent PDDL modelling and planning. Produce a complete PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that encode the Tower of Hanoi instance described by the agents. Target the FastDownwards solver by using a STRIPS-compatible PDDL formulation and avoid features not supported by FastDownwards. Always enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. You will receive concise peg descriptions from three agents. Integrate their information and produce a single PDDL domain and a single PDDL problem that solve moving seven disks A..G from the left peg to the right peg under Tower of Hanoi rules. Use clear predicates and actions compatible with FastDownwards. Keep agent-specific roles distinct only if it helps clarity. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
